subject: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/ADC093 FOR $3,500,000 USD
RE-IMMEDIATE PAYMENT COMPENSATION ORDER TO VICTIMS OF SCAM
This is to bring to your notice that there is verification exercise of scam victims being carried out starting from 6th of March, 2024  by the WORLDBANK/UNITED NATIONS  to pay victims of scam $3,500,000 (Three Million, Five Hundred Thousand Dollars Only).You are listed/approved for this payment as one of the scammed victims to be paid this amount.
On this faithful recommendations, want to alert you that during the last U.N. meetings held in WASHINGTON DC (USA), it was accessed and accumulated of reported cases of fraud that the money lost by various individuals to the ongoing global scam artists operating in syndicates all over the world today is over $239 Million United States Dollars since year 2007 till date to fraud in USA alone etc.
http:/ /www.techspot.com/news/29644-US-Citizens-lost-239-million-from-Internet-fraud-in-2007.html
In other to compensate victims, the WORLDBANK/UNITED NATIONS is now paying victims of such scam $3,500,000 (THREE MILLION, FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS EACH) in accordance with the UNITED NATIONS recommendations.
The payments are to be released via certified check through access bank as corresponding paying bank under funding assistance by FEDERAL RESERVE BANK NEW YORK. Benefactors of this compensation award will have to be first cleared by access bank and confirmed as a victim of Scam before the scam payment check can be issued and released. We shall feed you with further modalities as soon as we get response from you on how you can receive your compensation payment check award.
Send a copy of your valid international passport or driver's license along with your address, full names and telephone/fax numbers quoting your PAYMENT CODE NUMBER (FDNY/ADC093 ). All communications should be strictly via email for now and if need be for telephone contact we will inform you.
Looking forward to your urgent compliance.
Yours Faithfully,
Edward Ashante
PUBLIC RELATIONS OFFICER

subject: Re:  YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Hello Edward Ashante,

Wow, this is quite a surprise! I can't believe that such an initiative is being carried out by the World Bank and United Nations. It's really heartening to know that there are efforts being made to compensate victims of scams.

I'm curious about how this process works though. How did you determine who the victims are? And how was it decided that each victim would receive Three Million, Five Hundred Thousand Dollars?

Also, could you please explain more about what you mean by "this award will have to be first cleared by access bank"? What does it mean for the award to be cleared?

I'm sorry for all the questions, but I'm just trying to understand everything better. Looking forward to your response!

Best wishes,
Marvin

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Dear Marvin,


I confirm receipt of your email and its contents were noted and understood.

Your name appeared as one of the scammed victims.

The reason for this payment of the $3,500,000 to all victims is that the
World bank and the United Nations reasoned that some of those scammed
victims must have lost a huge sum of money ranging from $5.000,000,
$10,000,000, $15,000,000 etc to scammers.  So they decided to map out that
sum of $3,500,0000 for the compensation irrespective of how much the
scammed victim lost.

The Access bank will have to give their clearance to such a victim to
ensure that he or she is truly the person to receive this compensation to
avoid ghost victims.

This email was not sent to you alone.  It was equally sent to those other
victims that were involved.  Some contact information of some victims were
sent to me by the United Nations and I cannot explain how they got to know
about the actual victims.

So you should not get bothered or worried about this development.  All I
need is for you to confirm to us if you are the actual victim of this to
enable us to proceed.

Edward Ashante

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Hello Edward Ashante,

Thank you for your email. It's quite surprising to hear that my name appeared as one of the scammed victims. I'm not sure how this could have happened, but I appreciate the efforts of the World Bank and United Nations in trying to rectify such situations.

I understand that you need confirmation from me about being a victim. However, I'm a bit confused about how this process works. Could you please explain more about how the Access bank will give clearance? And what does it mean by "ghost victims"?

Also, could you provide more details on how my contact information was obtained by the United Nations? It's a bit unsettling to think that my information is out there without my knowledge.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Marvin

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Dear  Marvin,

It is like you are not among the beneficiaries of this compensation with
your questions showing that you are not the actual person, maybe we have
the wrong  contact information.


Edward Ashante

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Hello Edward Ashante,

Thank you for your message. I'm sorry if there was any confusion, but I assure you that I am the person you intended to contact. Could you please elaborate on what information or details led you to believe otherwise? I'm eager to clear up any misunderstandings and continue our conversation.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Marvin

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Dear Marvin,

I acknowledge receipt of your email.

The reason I said that you may not be the right beneficiary was due to your
previous response to my email. But if you are eager to receive this fund
you should confirm your full information such as your full names, address,
phone and any means of your identification card.

On receipt of your full information I will forward it to Access bank for
verification.

Waiting to hear from you.

Edward Ashante

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Dear Edward Ashante,

Thank you for your prompt response. I'm really excited about this opportunity, but I must admit, I'm a bit confused. Could you please explain more about the fund and how it works? 

Also, could you tell me more about Access Bank? How will they be involved in this process?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Marvin

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Marvin,

We cannot disclose any further information to you until we confirm your
full details such as your full names, address, phone and any form of your
identification card.

subject: Re: YOUR REF/PAYMENT CODE: FDNY/A
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. I'm really interested in learning more about what you're offering. Could you perhaps provide me with some more details? I'd love to understand better before we proceed further.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Marvin
